posts.content:
Went to Bugjam over the weekend, got a little RWYB in on the Friday, well only two runs before the rain stopped play.....

1st with allot of wheelspin and got a 17.70 @ 74.54mph, then another at 17.49 @ 74.28 mph...

the van was fairly full of fuel and I was taking it easy in 1st gear on my £30 gearbox!!!!


with less fuel and mastering the take off I recon there a mid 16 in it hopefully, but next time down the strip it migh weigh more when I finally finish the interior off!!

I'll post a link to the vids on Facebook/you tube latter in the week.. I've got my timing slip here took... Just wonderd how you 'join up' now???



i was also quite shock to see no other air cooled busses on the strip at all all weekend!!
there was two other busses, both Subaru powered tho, a the Tattitude single cab and a white double cab with wide5 slotmags....


just surprised there was no one else there really...

http://www.facebook.com/photo.php?fbid= ... e=1&ref=nf

so let me know what I need to do to join dudes... Cheers Alex
man, well done!

cheers man, heres the pic correctly uploaded (couldnt seem to link it with the Ipad!) and the vid on you tube, of the 2nd quicker run.... dam rain stopped play or there would have been a 16 in it (possibly!!)

http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=yUyZDc7s ... 1343301451




ive been on the BWA website, and since found out you need to be a SSVC paid up member and approved by the 6 founding members, so when i get a chance ill join the SSVC, but who puts your name forard to the 6 dudes?

cheers
alex

I think as long as your in the ssvc and you run a sub 18 seconds and have your timing slip to prove it and there is a member present at the show you should be ok.
Can't remember who the 6 are but Rikki James and vwjim are founders.
Hopefully one of the 6 will be present when you race!
Jules who runs the site is very helpful too Pm him and I'm sure he will help.

knowing its quicke enough to join is good enough for me, if ££ allows ill be at vw action doing the same on the friday with any luck!


might join the SSCV in preperation for that, cheers matey!

As I understand it, even if you weren't a member of the SSVC at the time of the run, that as long as you join shortly afterwards the run still counts.

Cheers
Paul
WELL DONE FELLA!! (Did you witness this Jules)

cheer's!

not bad for a little 1968cc (74x92) screemer!

bigger heads and bigger carbs next! ha!
